attributes.action: Maternity hospitals to have separate buildings for parents of baby loss
attributes.background: Parents who are suffering baby loss whether it be miscarriage, still birth or ectopic, shouldn't have to go through the maternity hospital to get checked out or give birth. Many hospitals have separate wings but you're still in the maternity hospital which is full of babies, pregnancy and reminders.

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: Right to buy for ALL social housing tenants, a fair chance at security for all!
attributes.background: Myself (tenant for 17 years) and my mother (tenant for 25 years) would like to buy our homes but neither of us qualify despite all our neighbours qualifying because they were tenants before the properties transferred to Housing association and our properties miss right to acquire rules by 1 year
attributes.additional_details:
It’s discrimination to say 1 has a right and 1 doesn’t. 
We are in the same properties on the same street owned by the same Housing association but those that want to buy can’t and those that can don’t want to! 
Give us a right to buy the homes we have lived in, raised our children in and made our own. Give our children security for their futures.
When we applied for social housing it’s because we had no alternative, now let us buy our HOMES and use the money for much needed additional housing!

attributes.action:
Stop medicine wastage
Give our unused medicines to developing countries in need
attributes.background:
Tons of unused medicines are returned to pharmacies every year.  These medicines are incinerated rather than re-issued.

Meanwhile developing countries are rife with counterfeit medicines.

Giving our unused unopened medicines to developing countries would relieve sufferring and harm.
attributes.additional_details:
When a medicine is returned to a pharmacy in the UK for whatever reason, we assume that it can't be re-used.  This is not so.  

Medicine wastage in the UK costs the NHS around £300 million with £110 million of pharmaceuticals returned unopened & unused to pharmacies every year.  Instead of re-issuing these medicines they are incinerated.

These drugs should be given to developing countries across the world in the fight against  counterfeit medicines which are rife and are causing actual harm.

attributes.action: Give UK armed forces recognition of their service during the cold war
attributes.background: Give UK armed forces personnel the same recognition as the rest of the world has done for their service during the cold war by allowing a medal too be issued.
attributes.additional_details: For all personnel who served past and present.

attributes.action: Transfer the responsibility of A422 Brackley - Banbury to Highways England
attributes.background: The section of the A422 between Brackley and Banbury is used quite heavily by all forms of transport at the moment the road is under Northamptonshire Highways, and not Highways England, plans for a Farthinghoe By Pass have yet to materialise.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the road is closed for a small bridge repair near Farthinghoe.
Which  is causing chaos with minor roads unsuitable for use of high traffic volumes. The road is also a diversion route for M40 Traffic from Junction 10 to 11 vice versa when road accidents occur on the motorway between those junctions.

attributes.action: Ensure all schools offer reception children a full time education from September
attributes.background: Every September many schools accept reception children for only part of a day for up to 6 weeks, causing enormous difficulties for many parents. Working parents have to take leave, unpaid leave in the case of self-employed parents, or pay huge childcare costs while the phased start is in place
attributes.additional_details:
There is little awareness of a ruling by the Schools Adjudicator in 2013 who said, in reference to phased starts, “It is not permissible in my view for a school to deny a child a term of full-time education. The school has a duty to provide a full-time place from September and cannot refuse to do so.”

The latest school admissions code supports this, stating that a local authority must make clear that children are entitled to a full-time place in the Sept following their fourth birthday.

attributes.action: Urge Saudi government to reduce pilgrimage fees
attributes.background: The British government should help British Muslims by passing the message to the Saudi government that British Muslims are not happy with the Umrah fee. Not every Muslim can’t afford to pay the extra fee
attributes.additional_details: Umrah is a spiritual journey for every Muslim all around the world, but for the last two years the Saudi government has made it harder for Muslims. It’s British parliament responsibility to raise our views with the Saudi government.

attributes.action: Create minimum wage for SIA holders to be paid £15 per hour.
attributes.background: How many SIA staff would like to be paid a minimum of £15 per hour?
attributes.additional_details: Comments later, just sign up everyone.

attributes.action: Review the unfair school fine system where 2 parent families pay twice
attributes.background: The penalty for taking a child out of school is on a per person, per child basis. This means two parent families have to pay the fine twice. This is unfair and should be reviewed.

attributes.action: Don’t scrap the 1p or 2p coin
attributes.background: Recently there have been calls for the 1p and 2p coin to be scrapped. I believe that this would have a huge effect of the UK public, This would mean any tax increases would jump to a minimum of 5p, that has an effect on petrol prices, shop prices would increase, leaving the British public worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets etc would increase prices by 5p per item when they do increase a price, for eg, Mr & Mrs Public go shopping to their local supermarket, the store has had a store wide increase on tinned goods, so the couple buy 20 tins of varied products, all of which have had an increase of 5p, thats an extra £1 on that shop alone, £52 a year rise in costs, that’s just on one example of shopping, let alone the other rises, to jump from a 1p rise to a 5p rise is too much for a lot of people.

attributes.action: Make parental alienation a criminal offence
attributes.background: Parental alienation should be included in the definition of the offence of Controlling or Coercive Behaviour. The current offence doesn’t include control through children such as changing arrangements and no shows.

attributes.action: Make Sileby Train station more accessible.
attributes.background: Our community wants better access to Sileby train station so that wheelchair users, individuals who have mobility issues and individuals who have children in pushchairs. There are many steps going up to the platform. Therefore wheelchairs, pushchairs and those who cannot manage steps cannot access.

attributes.action: a maximum amount to be specified for school uniforms
attributes.background: School uniforms are now ridiculously expensive and even primarily schools are now setting excessive rules on school uniforms.  Parents are effectively paying hundreds of pounds in “fees” just to send a child to school.  Parents should not have pay for these excessive uniforms
attributes.additional_details: Schools should be ordered to set a maximum amount of £50 for the whole uniform and any costs in excess of this must be bourne by the school.  This would also prevent schools from selecting one supplier who can then dictate the price people pay.  As education is mandatory parents should not be forced into paying excessive amounts just to send a child to school

attributes.action: Introduce a benefit payment to all diagnosis of cancer patients
attributes.background: When you are diagnosed with cancer your world is turned upside down for the patient and there familys many cancer victims are off work for long periods of time with no help from the government am asking the government to provide a benefit to help them fight this awful disease and make life easier
attributes.additional_details: Cancer is a five year programme and can return at anyone point during the five years

attributes.action: Legalise the usage and possession of Psychedelic drugs.
attributes.background:
There is astounding reports of these substances changing many people's lives, tackling depression and mental health issues.
We would like the laws reevaluated in order for proper clinical testing to take place.
We believe these substances will have a great impact in the field of psychiatry.
attributes.additional_details:
Dimethyltryptamine is a naturally occurring chemical in all of nature's plants. The human body is said to possibly produce this chemical and we currently do not know enough about this substance due to its legal status.

Research needs to be done into the potential medicinal benefits of this substance to tackle chronic depression etc.

attributes.action: Increase the funding and support for the production of shale gas by fracking
attributes.background:
Fracking has the potential to boost the UK economy. It will increase job opportunities, lower imported fuel, whilst bringing a higher tax revenue with greater energy security.

The production of shale gas would reduce volatility within the wholesale market.
attributes.additional_details:
Local communities would see significant benefits from fracking economically with an increase of job opportunities. The first 100 sites could create 74,000 jobs.

Local communities which host sites will also be rewarded more directly. In June 2013, UKOOG announced its first industry-wide community benefits scheme where the local community will benefit to the sum of £100,000.

The industry estimates that it could add up to over £1.1bn in a 25 year period or about £5m to £10m per site.

attributes.action: Set a government cap on the price of Fuel
attributes.background: The price of Petrol is getting ridiculous and has gone up everyday for months, it should be capped at £1.00 a litre.

attributes.action: Stop long distance live animal transport for fattening or slaughter to/from UK.
attributes.background: This topic has been petitioned before and finished in March 2018.  I would like the topic to be kept in the public eye and to remind the appropriate government departments (Trade and industry / Farming and Agriculture) do not let this important issue to slip through the net.

attributes.action: Make public stadiums and arenas ban or charge for single use plastic cups.
attributes.background: Make all stadiums, public arenas and any venue using plastic cups/bottles either ban the use of these and use a paper alternative or have a deposit scheme where a charge is applied for anyone using a plastic cup/bottle and is refunded when the cup/bottle is returned.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic takes between 500-1000 years to degrade.

50% of sea turtles have consumed plastic.

1,000,000 sea birds and 100,000 marine animals are killed each year due to plastic waste.

There is more micro-plastic in the sea then stars in the Milky Way.

Single use bags, Straws, cups and bottle are the most common type of plastic pollution found in the ocean.

All the plastic that has ever been made is still around in one shape or another (excluding that which has been incinerated)

attributes.action: Amend the PPERA 2000 to ban all foreign donations at all times
attributes.background:
The UK currently allows foreigners to donate to political causes and campaigns. The PPERA allows this outside of election campaigns, which gives foreign money undue influence in United kingdom political life.

The PPERA 2000 should be amended to ban all such at all times

attributes.action: Address the quality of food being served to patients in NHS hospitals.
attributes.background:
The current state of food in both general and mental health hospitals is very poor. 
The fresh frozen produce being served across many NHS hospitals is costly, unappealing and wasteful. 
I believe that this needs to be addressed as it is impacting on people's physical and mental recovery.
attributes.additional_details:
I have seen first hand the quality of food which is served to patients and the amount of waste it creates.
 
When good quality food is fresh and appealing it has a massive impact on a patient’s recovery time which helps to reduce the time spent in hospital.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking on streets
attributes.background: Smoking on the streets is bad for other people through passive smoking and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It was proven that when the indoor smoking ban was brought into force over 700,000 people stopped smoking

attributes.action: life in prison for those that cause death through drink driving
attributes.background: As a biker I know of far too many lives affected throughbdrink driving

attributes.action: Automatic imprisonment for assaulting member of emergency services.
attributes.background: Members of the NHS and other emergency service members are being subjected to an increase in physical assaults and threats whilst attempting to carry out their lawful duty.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the Fire and Rescue Services are the latest in a long list of public services who are suffering physical threat and injury at the hands of criminal elements within our society.

attributes.action:
Universal Credit!
Abolish the waiting time to receive money
attributes.background: The new Universal Credit replaces JSA, Income Support, ESA, Housing Benefit, Tax Credits and Working Tax Credits.
attributes.additional_details:
The rollout of Universal Credit has left many people in poverty. 
Once a person has claimed UC, all their benefits stop until the UC claim has been processed. 
This takes around 5 weeks to process.
We believe the Government should abolish the waiting time for a claimant to receive their money. 
Families face a choice of heating or eating. 
In 21st century Britain this is wrong.
Abolish the 5 week waiting period now!

attributes.action: Zero Hour contracts should be abolished.
attributes.background:
Zero hours contracts should be abolished to stop exploitation of the work force. They do not offer regular working hours and lead to poor working practices. 
It is time Government legislated to outlaw them.

attributes.action: Parliament debate on the Right of Reply of people attacked in daily newspapers
attributes.background: It is intolerable and unfair that individuals attacked and criticised in the daily newspapers in the UK are not presently afforded the Right of Reply in said newspapers.
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is deemed necessary to debate whether individuals attacked in the UK mass media should be afforded an automatic Right of Reply to respond and the editors of the relevant newspapers should be made by law to publish those individuals replies with space afforded equal to the column size of the original articles which attacked them.

attributes.action: Force all new build house purchases to have a retainer on purchase agreements.
attributes.background: More new build houses are being built each day. Problems with new builds are soaring and NHBC warranties is not enough to protect buyers. Developers should be force to accept retainer agreements from purchasers to protect them against nightmare builds, retaining part of funds until work is completed
attributes.additional_details: I am a new build homeowner. 8 months in to date. We have suffered unimaginable losses financially and also mentally due to a nightmare build. We have had drains incorrectly installed, we have a house that does not have building control sign off and we are still no where near getting our house right. I live on a street where 10 other residents also have houses that are not signed off from building control, yet we are living in these houses. The system is very very broken and people are suffering.

attributes.action: The cost of a colour TV licence should be cut to £100.
attributes.background:
BBC news and current affairs programmes are no longer of high quality.
In an age of austerity where ordinary people are struggling to make ends meet, a licence fee of £150 is no longer justified for substandard broadcasting.
attributes.additional_details:
As a national broadcaster, the BBC is expected to be fearless, objective and impartial in its reporting of news and current affairs programming.
The BBC often avoids or downplays politically sensitive news items, allows statements to go unchallenged and uses false equivalence to counter balance expert opinion.
These are not the attributes expected of a national broadcaster in a leading democratic nation.

attributes.action: Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges while on duty.
attributes.background:
Emergency services to be exempt from parking tickets or charges.

Lights and/or siren not required to be active for exemption.

Only requirement is for staff to be on duty (on call) but not restricted to being on a call and is to include brake times.
attributes.additional_details: www.express.co.uk/news/uk/993969/parking-warden-ticket-paramedics-north-west-ambulance-service/amp

attributes.action: Don't sell Linton-on-ouse
attributes.background: Keep RAF Linton on ouse open it's the best fast jet training facility

attributes.action: Oppose the death penalty for IS 'Beatles' duo
attributes.background: Whatever the crime, the UK government must oppose the death penalty as a matter of principle. A letter leaked to the Telegraph shows that the UK government would seek no assurances about the sentences of Alexanda Kotey and El Shafee Elsheikh if the pair were extradited to the US.

attributes.action: Urge the Nigerian Government to protect civilians
attributes.background: Nigeria is a former colony and protectorate of the Imperial British Empire. Now it is an independent nation. There is a general insecurity fuelled by violence and killings. Action is required now to protect the Nigerian people and bring peace to the country.

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday from March 29th 2019
attributes.background: this is the day we officially leave the EU therefore it is only fitting that one of the most important days in modern history is marked as a national holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaker John Bercow said the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, which repeals the 1972 European Communities Act through which Britain became a member of the bloc, had received royal assent from Queen Elizabeth II.

The bill transfers decades of European law onto British statute books, and also enshrines Brexit day in British law as March 29, 2019 at 11pm (2300 GMT) -- midnight Brussels time.

Prime Minister Theresa May said the approval was a "historic moment for our country, and a significant step towards delivering on the will of the British people".

attributes.action: Abolish the "Dangerous dogs act 1991" and replace it with a licence to keep dogs
attributes.background:
The so called dangerous dogs act was created in haste and without much research on the dogs themselves.

I feel any respectful owner would happily pay a 1 off fee to keep a family dog(s) and hopefully keep them from falling into the wrong hands, please sign this petition to legalise these breeds
attributes.additional_details:
Small dogs are generally more agressive than any large breed, Chihuahuas are recorded with most bites but they dont do as much damage as a large breed and this is deemed to be acceptable which it is not.

Pitbulls are caring, loving, faithful family dogs where in America they are effectionally known as the "nanny dog"

Pitbulls in the uk are a very misunderstood breed and have been stigmatized because of small minded individuals that used these dogs in the wrong setting i.e fighting

attributes.action: Ban the sale of rat poison to prevent its misuse to protect other animals
attributes.background: There are frequent cases of the misuse of rat poison resulting in the poisoning of dogs, cats and other animals. There are other ways in which rats can be controlled so I would like to see the sale and use of Rat Poison banned.
attributes.additional_details: A simple search of the internet will find multiple cases.

attributes.action:
Allow a 
Referendum on changing the House Of Lords to a fully Elected Chamber
attributes.background: Abolition of the House of Lords has been debated. No clear way forward to address people’s concerns was forthcoming; though their was some acknowledgement of it overstepping it’s remit, particularly to thwart the people’s decision for Brexit. The chamber needs to better reflect people’s wishes.
attributes.additional_details: An elected chamber, drawn from all walks of life and being fully representative of the electorate should replace the current system. There should not be allowed to be overwhelming numbers from one particular political party or persuasion. Elected members should not need to be past MPs and could be experts in their field - elected to scrutinise in particular areas. People need to be able to trust that the powers given to scrutinise are not abused, nor guided by personal agenda or preference.

attributes.action: Make cyclists require a cycling licence that they must carry at all times.
attributes.background: I have nearly been hit three times by cyclists going at high speed around corners. Cyclists never use bells anymore so silently sneak up on you and shoot past (on the pavement).
attributes.additional_details: Many people have called for regulation of cycling. This has been impractical as bikes do not need reg numbers (like cars) but this proposal is new. I propose that cyclists themselves should have to purchase a licence from the DVLA which can be revoked if guilty of dangerous cycling.

attributes.action: FREE sanitary products for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis. 10% of women world wide have endometriosis - that's 176 million worldwide. Women with endometriosis usually experience extremely heavy and painful periods and can go through as many as 20 night time pads in an average day.

attributes.action: The country needs more Social Housing
attributes.background: In London the average waiting time for Social Housing is 10 years. For families that are in financial difficulties, this is a long wait. They will be moved around areas,moving from one temporary property to another. To fix this issue we need more Social housing across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to The Guardian: The idea of affordable housing has been 'twisted and out of shape'

attributes.action: Funding help for clients attending private practice for mental health issues
attributes.background: Clients attend private practice for Counselling/Psychotherapy as advised by GP/NICE guidance and most need help with funding due to financial constraints. Long waiting lists of more than 6 months for charities and other voluntary services. Immediate intervention needed to prevent complex issues
attributes.additional_details: NICE guidance states that individuals struggling with mental health conditions such as anxiety and depression etc benefit from Counselling/Psychotherapy.  Early interventions and home treatment for mental health problems can reduce hospital admissions, shorten hospital stays and require fewer high-cost intensive interventions. This can potentially result in a saving of up to £38 million per year.

attributes.action: Brexit must mean leaving the Defence Union
attributes.background: The Chequers plan keeps the UK signed up to EU defence and weapons development budgets. Veterans for Britain’s briefing paper reveals how the UK has reached such a perilous position, where we are close to giving away political control over large parts of defence decision-making to new EU structures
attributes.additional_details:
A crucial intervention in The Times by ex-MI6 chief Sir Richard Dearlove plus military and academic figures, pointed out how the Cabinet Office Europe Unit, headed by Oliver Robbins, had shared information about the defence negotiating position with EU diplomats before these details and their consequences had been explained to MPs.

The EU has no business being in defence or security at all. These should be either NATO or nation-to-nation matters.

attributes.action: Call for a global moratorium on deforestation.
attributes.background: While high-tech carbon dioxide removal solutions are under development, the “natural technology” of forests is currently the only proven means of removing and storing atmospheric CO2 at a scale that can meaningfully contribute to achieving carbon balance.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.climateandlandusealliance.org/scientists-statement/

attributes.action: Allow severely disabled children to remain in the care home they grew up in.
attributes.background: When children in care reach 18 years old they have to move on to adult services and have to move out of the care home they have grown up in and leave the carers who know them best. Changes need to be made to the relevant regulations for this to happen.

attributes.action: Require all supermarkets to have an Eco packaging/Local produce/Vegan section
attributes.background: People know of the harm that use of plastic/meat and dairy industry/food flown thousands of miles is having on the planet and are doing all they can, but options are limited and that makes people feel there's not much they can help with. So with this petition we require ALL supermarkets to have:
attributes.additional_details:
1.ECO Section: include zero- plastic products - 'naked' veg and fruit; grains, bread, pasta, spices packaged in paper; milk, oils, juices in glass bottles; toiletries - solid shampoos, conditioners, toothpaste, deodorants
 
2.Local Produce Section: to reduce carbon footprint of our shopping, consumers should be able to easily find products grown locally.
 
3.Increase vegan produce at least two-fold, stocking a reasonable selection in local stores as well, giving eco friendly options to everyone

attributes.action: Brexit - Follow a Canada Plus Deal with the EU
attributes.background: In June 2016 the UK voted to leave the EU. We call on our Government to honour our instruction and follow a Canada Plus deal to deliver what was promised.
attributes.additional_details: In June 2016 the UK voted to leave the EU. It was clearly explained in the pre-referendum leaflet what voting ‘leave’ would result in. Our instruction to the Government was for this to be carried out. The Chequers deal does not deliver on this promise and we instruct the Government to negotiate for the future UK/EU relationship to be based on an enhanced version of the EU/Canada Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement to deliver that promise.

attributes.action: Make nutrition a mandatory subject for children to learn in schools.
attributes.background: Making nutrition a mandatory subject in schools will help in the growing obesity rates in children and adults, this will lead to less of a strain on the NHS in the future.

attributes.action: Ban escort review websites like UK Punting
attributes.background: On certain online escort review discussion boards, such as UK Punting, users submit aggressive & potentially defamatory posts about women. These websites ask for reviews to contain a link, contact details or address of the escort, which can put them at risk.
attributes.additional_details: The posts may contain unfounded accusations and fake reviews. Pictures of the escorts can be posted without consent. Such sites are dangerous to ALL women, not just sex workers. Appearing on them can lead to women being harassed, outed and having their addresses made public, which could result in criminal damage and burglary. Users can even post pictures of women in the street and give derogatory accounts of what they would like to do to them in locked sections of these forums.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on the UK remaining/leaving the Customs Union
attributes.background: In 2016 the British people voted to leave the EU . However there’s still no consensus on what form a Brexit can take which has caused much conflict on issues like trade and the Irish border .A simple solution would be to allow the electorate to decide if we leave or remain in the Customs Union.
